place.name: ST PETROX
place.gazetteerText: PETROX (St.), or Llan-Pedrog, a parish in the district and county of Pembroke; 3 miles S by W of Pembroke r. station. Post-town, Pembroke. Acres, 967. Real property, £1, 627. Pop., 78. Houses, 16. The living is a rectory, annexed to the rectory of Stackpole-Elidor, in the diocese of St. Davids. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
